intro: Pertya desmocephala, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a small, creeping liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Pterygopariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces distinctive yellowish-green gametophores that bear the reproductive structures. It thrives in humid conditions, often growing on rocks or decaying wood in temperate regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
